text: every year thousands of people descend
on Omaha Nebraska to baskin the mystique
of legendary investor Warren Buffett
this is the annual shareholders meeting
of Berkshire Hathaway it is popularly
known as Buffett Palooza as the serious
business of explaining the company's
strategy and policies gets underway in
Omaha's Key West arena thousands of
people throng the convention center next
door they come from all over the world
some are shareholders of Berkshire
Hathaway's premium-priced shares but
many are just there to bask in the
shadow of the sage of Omaha I wish we
had more financial executives like
Lauren then are more interested in
building the economy in the building
companies rather than saying how much
can I get for
the event is a testament to mr.
Buffett's popularity and to the
popularity of Berkshire Hathaway and its
brands few finance executives enjoy the
cachet of mr. Buffett but that sterling
reputation was tarnished recently in a
scandal involving alleged insider
trading by one of his top lieutenants
David sokol although mr. Buffett spoke
extensively about mr. Sokol's
resignation and what it might mean for
Berkshire the situation has left some
shareholders uneasy they talked a lot
about the David soulful situation but
then they didn't really get deep into
the succession I was not satisfied mr.
Buffett is 80 years old and he has been
famously tight-lipped about his
succession plans but the sokol affair
hardly touched the excitement of the
visitors at buffett Palooza and it may
have little lasting impact on his
reputation after all he is known for
focusing on the long-term investment not
the short-term hold he's not interested
in next quarter
he's interesting what's good for the
next five this is maca william bishop
for DealBook at the New York Times
reporting from Omaha Nebraska
